ygData.subject: Re: Gnomestock '99
ygData.msgSnippet: I would like to say that this was a blast for me too.  It was really cool to see all of you guys there....I got to meet a few that I have seen posting regular
ygData.messageBody:
I would like to say that this was a blast for me too. It was really
cool to see all of you guys there....I got to meet a few that I have
seen posting regular notes on the list and felt very priveledged.
*waves at Sylly*. Thanks for letting me be a part of it. Things went
very well...3 hours and most of the little gnomes were in the lava...I
was the poor druid trying to port all the little guys...my thank you to
the kind soul who cast clarity on me so that this was possible. Thanks
to Aloro for arranging it. It was alot of fun...and you know that on
our server they were all referring to it as gnomespam 99. I loved
going back and looking at all the dead gnome bodies later...heheh

Thanks all!

Crysarra <Core Alliance>
druid 33rd season

--- Ken Bachman <kbachman@...> wrote:
> I just wanted to note that I had a lot of (admittedly ridiculous) fun
> at
> this event. It's tough to describe for those of you who missed it,
> but
> try and picture 60 drunken Gnomes outside the Freeport gates, waving
> lutes and charging en masse to Lavastorm. And boy, did we annoy the
> Dark
> Elves in Nektulos! (Did you ever notice that Dark Elves have no
> sense of
> humor?)
>
> I actually managed to make it to the Temple of Solusek Ro ledge,
> where I
> was able to fling myself into the lava along with perhaps twenty
> others
> that I saw up there. There was, sadly, a fair amount of attrition
> along
> the way (not unexpected). I tried to get back two more times, but
> kept
> getting chomped by piranhas in the Nektulos river.
>
> My roommate, who generally raises an eyebrow at this game, watched
> most
> of it and found it hilarious.
>
> I wanted to thank Aloro, et al, for organizing this, and the E'ci
> higher
> level players who spent several hours helping all of us idiots with
> teleports, binding, SOW, beer and lutes. I'd appreciate it if you
> E'ci
> bards could pass on my thanks.
>
> Kenross Cantoforjado, 34 songs, Innoruuk
>
>
------------------------------------------------------------------------
> Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to
> lol@... with the subject submissions.
>
<HR>
<html>
>
